intro: Cnemidaria mutica var. contigua, commonly known as the common velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is native to regions in Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is often considered an invasive species in many areas outside its native range.
